Miscellaneous

FileFetcher

Several functions in MLX data can make use of a FileFetcher object to fetch files from a remote location. See the installation instructions to build MLX data with AWS support which adds the core.AWSFileFetcher described below.

core.AWSFileFetcher.__init__(self, bucket[, ...])

Make an AWSFileFetcher to fetch files from S3.

core.AWSFileFetcher.fetch(self, filename)

Ensures the filename is in the local cache.

core.AWSFileFetcher.prefetch(self, filenames)

Start prefetching these files.

A FileFetcher can also be used standalone in your scripts to efficiently fetch remote content in background threads.

from pathlib import Path
from mlx.data.core import AWSFileFetcher

LOCAL_CACHE = Path("/path/to/local/cache")

ff = AWSFileFetcher(
    "my-cool-bucket",
    endpoint="https://my.endpoint.com/"
    local_prefix=LOCAL_CACHE,
    num_kept_files=100,
)

# When fetch returns my/remote/path/foo.npy will be in LOCAL_CACHE
ff.fetch("my/remote/path/foo.npy")
assert (LOCAL_CACHE / "my/remote/path/foo.npy").is_file()

# We can prefetch in the background
ff.prefetch(["foo_1.npy", "foo_2.npy"])
ff.fetch("foo_1.npy")
# process foo_1 while foo_2 downloads in the background
